2 days ago, this Bitcoin OG
(0xb317d2bc2d3d2df5fa441b5bae0ab9d8b07283ae)

Deposited  $20M to Hyperliquid and opened a 5x leveraged long position on 14,277 ETH with an entry price of $2,965.85 and a liquidation threshold at $1,597.9.

Subsequently, the total deposits reached $70M, expanding the ETH long to 54,277 ETH, worth $166.4M.

Later, the OG partially closed 4,513 ETH for a realized profit of $305,000, retaining a 50,001 ETH position valued at $155.7M, which held $3.4M in unrealized gains at that point.

The position was then ramped up again to 67,103.68 ETH, totaling $209.8M, with over $4M in unrealized profits.

Today, as ETH rallied, the holding grew to 70,001 ETH at $227.7M, accumulating more than $12.87M in unrealized profits.

Finally, instead of securing gains, the OG doubled down to 85,001 ETH, valued at $280M, pushing unrealized profits beyond $16M as of the latest update.

Does this BitcoinOG know something?

Hyperliquid is spending about $103M a month on buybacks, but token unlocks are releasing roughly $270M onto the market. With only about 38% of that sell pressure being absorbed, the numbers stop adding up. The fact that Lighter and Aster are launching right as this imbalance hits isnâ€™t a coincidence â€” itâ€™s a strategic opening. For $HYPE  to keep up with the dilution, revenue would need to grow more than 2.5x. Meanwhile, competitors donâ€™t need to generate any revenue at all to attract users who are exhausted by constant unlock-driven sell pressure. The strategy works because Hyperliquid canâ€™t offer aggressive incentives without speeding up its own downward cycle.

Economic Engines driving real revenue  Projects like $HYPE  and $ADA  intrinsically have the token as part of the blockchainâ€™s fabric.  This is best displayed with Tanssi.  The entire ecosystem and functionality are built around having a token with multiple utilities, all built into the protocol.  Hereâ€™s how it works: More validators and sequencers staking for security. More sequencer slots require bonding/rotation. More blocks are produced across sovereign L1s, each secured and paid for with TANSSI. More interchain messages and transactions require TANSSI as the fee asset.  With such robust and consistent, sustainable usecase, itâ€™s clear to see how Tanssi is among the top ranks of having a real economic engine which helps them drive revenue.  #Macro Insights#
